intro: Navarretia lutea, commonly known as the yellow navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Navarretia lutea is known for its short growing season, often blooming in early spring before the summer heat arrives. Its structure is low-growing with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves.
